intro: Ptosimopappus, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant is known for its showy yellow or orange blooms that appear in late summer to early fall. Ptosimopappus species are typically shrubs or subshrubs with hairy, gray-green foliage adapted to withstand drought. These plants play an important ecological role by providing nectar for pollinators in their native habitats.
